title: Understanding the Information Cycle
text: The information cycle describes how news and information about an event are disseminated over time. It starts with immediate sources and progresses to more detailed analyses.

title: Immediate Sources
text: Right after an event occurs, the first sources to report are usually online platforms and social media. These provide real-time updates.

title: Next Day Coverage
text: By the next day, traditional media like newspapers often provide more detailed reports, summarizing the event with verified information.
